text: The Typist Gets Married (French: La dactylo se marie) is a 1934 French-German comedy film directed by Joe May and René Pujol and starring Marie Glory, Jean Murat and Armand Bernard.Bock & Bergfelder p.316 It was a sequel to the 1931 film The Typist which also starred Glory. The film's sets were designed by Max Heilbronner. ==Cast== * Marie Glory as Simone * Jean Murat as Paul Derval * Armand Bernard as Jules Fanfarel * Mady Berry as Thérèse * André Berley as Bloch * Marcel Maupi as Le chauffeur * Palau * Rognoni as Gaillard * Léon Larive as Le maître d'hotel * Pierre Huchet as Le commissaire * Nichette Yvon * Teddy Dargy as Bloch * Lucien Pardies * Andrée Dorns == References == == Bibliography == * Bock, Hans-Michael & Bergfelder, Tim. The Concise Cinegraph: Encyclopaedia of German Cinema. title: The Typist Gets Married
